original: @199a * // mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i 'grel ba tshul gsum gsal ba zhes bya ba bzhugs//
analyzed: @199a * // mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i 'grel ba tshul gsum gsal ba zhes bya ba bzhugs//
translated: The Commentary on the Essence of True Eloquence Called “The Illumination of the Three Methods”🔽🔽

original: * // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: * // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Commentary on the Meaning of the Words of the Noble Mañjuśrī’s Heroic March, called “Illuminating the Three Methods”

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ni ji lta bu zhig / de'i mtshan ni gang dang gang rnams yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ni ji lta bu zhig / de'i mtshan ni gang dang gang rnams yin /
translated: In the Noble Mañjuśrī’s Heroic March, what is the nature of the one called “Noble Mañjuśrī”? What are his names?

original: de yang dag par brjod pa ni ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de yang dag par brjod pa ni ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How is he described?

original: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: In this regard, Noble Mañjuśrī is nondual wisdom.

original: de ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi @199b ye shes kyi bdag nyid /
analyzed: de ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi @199b ye shes kyi bdag nyid /
translated: He is the nature of the wisdom of all buddhas of the three times.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo chos thams cad kyi chos nyid dang tha me dad pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo chos thams cad kyi chos nyid dang tha me dad pa yin te /
translated: He is the essence of bodhicitta, not different from the dharmatā of all phenomena.

original: de'i dbang gis snang ba'i gzugs kyi sku longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul ba'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis snang ba'i gzugs kyi sku longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul ba'i bdag nyid can /
translated: By his power, the form kāyas that appear are the nature of the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya.

original: ye shes kyi rten du snang ba /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rten du snang ba /
translated: They appear as the support of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs rnams su theg pa che chung gi tshul sna tshogs las grags par snang ba'i bdag nyid de rnams kyang 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs rnams su theg pa che chung gi tshul sna tshogs las grags par snang ba'i bdag nyid de rnams kyang 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes 'dod do //
translated: The various forms of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, which appear to be the nature of the various traditions of the greater and lesser vehicles, are also asserted to be the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: 'dir dris pa /
analyzed: 'dir dris pa /
translated: Here, it is asked:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin na phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes rnams chos can gcig gam tha dad pa cig yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin na phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes rnams chos can gcig gam tha dad pa cig yin /
translated: If the noble Mañjuśrī is the nature of the nondual wisdom of all buddhas, are the individual self-cognizant wisdoms of the buddhas of the three times and ten directions the same or different?

original: de bzhin du de'i chos nyid dang / de'i mdzad pa yang gcig gam tha dad pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i chos nyid dang / de'i mdzad pa yang gcig gam tha dad pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Likewise, is their dharmatā and their activity the same or different?

original: smras pa de ni 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa de ni 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: It is said that this should be understood as follows:

original: kha cig gi tshul las ni /
analyzed: kha cig gi tshul las ni /
translated: According to some systems,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes kyi rgyud kyang tha dad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes kyi rgyud kyang tha dad /
translated: the wisdom continua of the tathāgatas are different.

original: de'i chos nyid dang de'i mdzad pa yang tha dad de /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid dang de'i mdzad pa yang tha dad de /
translated: Their dharmatā and their activity are also different.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: But they are equal in four ways.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: chos mtshungs pa dang / sku mtshungs pa dang / gsung mtshungs pa dang / yi ge mtshungs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: chos mtshungs pa dang / sku mtshungs pa dang / gsung mtshungs pa dang / yi ge mtshungs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: They are equal in terms of the Dharma, equal in terms of body, equal in terms of speech, and equal in terms of syllables.

original: kha cig gi tshul las ni /
analyzed: kha cig gi tshul las ni /
translated: According to one system,

original: ye shes ni gang zag gi rgyud so so las sgrub pa'i phyir tha dad de /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang zag gi rgyud so so las sgrub pa'i phyir tha dad de /
translated: because gnosis is established in the continuum of each individual, it is different.

original: de'i chos nyid dang mdzad pa dag ni 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid dang mdzad pa dag ni 'dres pa ste /
translated: But its reality and its deeds are mixed;

original: tha dad pa med do zhes 'dod /
analyzed: tha dad pa med do zhes 'dod /
translated: they are not different.

original: kha cig gi tshul las ni /
analyzed: kha cig gi tshul las ni /
translated: According to another system,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du 'byed pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du 'byed pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags yin la /
translated: it is the habitual tendency of the view of self that distinguishes the continua of self and others.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The view of self is a delusion;

original: des bskyed cing de'i dbang gis snang ba ni /
analyzed: des bskyed cing de'i dbang gis snang ba ni /
translated: that which is produced by it and appears due to its power

original: de ltar bden pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa ma yin la /
translated: is not real in that way.

original: sems can gyi dus na yang rgyud tha dad mi 'grub na /
analyzed: sems can gyi dus na yang rgyud tha dad mi 'grub na /
translated: If the continua of self and others are not established even at the time of sentient beings,

original: bdag tu lta ba'i mdud pa mi mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas rnams la ye shes tha dad kyi rgyud du ga la 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i mdud pa mi mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas rnams la ye shes tha dad kyi rgyud du ga la 'grub ste /
translated: How could the buddhas, who are free of the knot of the view of self, be established as having different continua of exalted wisdom?

original: de bas na sangs rgyas rnams la ni rgyud tha dad pa dang / rgyud tha dad pas don mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du tshul tha dad pas don mdzad pa dang / zhing tha dad du don mdzad pa dang / dus tha dad du don mdzad pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas rnams la ni rgyud tha dad pa dang / rgyud tha dad pas don mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du tshul tha dad pas don mdzad pa dang / zhing tha dad du don mdzad pa dang / dus tha dad du don mdzad pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: Therefore, the buddhas do not have different continua, do not perform benefits through different continua, do not perform benefits through different modes, do not perform benefits in different realms, and do not perform benefits at different times.

original: ji srid du theg pa che chung gi gsung rab rnams las 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes grags pa dang / spyan ras @200a * //
analyzed: ji srid du theg pa che chung gi gsung rab rnams las 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes grags pa dang / spyan ras @200a * //
translated: As long as the teachings of the Great and Lesser Vehicles are renowned as the noble Mañjuśrī,

original: gzigs dbang phyug dang / phyag na rdo rje zhe'am /
analyzed: gzigs dbang phyug dang / phyag na rdo rje zhe'am /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, and Vajrapāṇi,

original: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa dang / mar me mdzad dang / byams pa zhe'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa dang / mar me mdzad dang / byams pa zhe'am /
translated: and as the buddhas Śākyamuni, Dīpaṃkara, and Maitreya,🔽and as Vairocana, Akṣobhya, and Ratnasambhava,

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / dkon mchog dpal zhes bya ba la sogs par grags pa /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / dkon mchog dpal zhes bya ba la sogs par grags pa /
translated: and so on,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul /
translated: the enjoyment body and emanations

original: pa'i skur grags shing /
analyzed: pa'i skur grags shing /
translated: He is renowned as the body of the Buddha.

original: so so'i gdul bya dang / zhing khams dang / tshul dang / bstan pa dang / dus tha dad du ye shes chen po'i rten du snang ba thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi chos nyid rtogs pa dbang dang /
analyzed: so so'i gdul bya dang / zhing khams dang / tshul dang / bstan pa dang / dus tha dad du ye shes chen po'i rten du snang ba thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi chos nyid rtogs pa dbang dang /
translated: All the appearances that are the supports for the great wisdom of the different disciples, fields, methods, teachings, and times are also the dharmata of the nondual wisdom of the Buddha.

original: sngon gyi smon lam dang thugs rje'i shugs kyis gdul bya dkar po'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i blo la /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam dang thugs rje'i shugs kyis gdul bya dkar po'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i blo la /
translated: By the power of previous aspirations and compassion, for the minds of disciples who have the imprints of virtue,

original: so sor snang tsam gyis phye ba las ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: so sor snang tsam gyis phye ba las ma gtogs pa /
translated: they appear individually, but apart from that,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang du ni bye brag phra mo tsam yang rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang du ni bye brag phra mo tsam yang rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: from the perspective of the buddhas, not even the slightest distinction can be found.

original: de bas na 'dir 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi yon tan brjod pa 'di ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan brjod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi yon tan brjod pa 'di ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan brjod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this praise of the qualities of noble Mañjuśrī should be understood as a praise of the qualities of all the buddhas of the three times and ten directions.

original: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi skur snang ba'i tshul la brten nas tshul so sor grags pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi skur snang ba'i tshul la brten nas tshul so sor grags pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The way in which he appears in the form of the noble Mañjuśrī is known in different ways, according to the different traditions.

original: nyan thos kyi tshul las ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud du gtogs pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshul las ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud du gtogs pa /
translated: According to the Śrāvaka tradition, the one called the noble Mañjuśrī belongs to the lineage of bodhisattvas,

original: da dung 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa so so'i skye bor 'dod do //
analyzed: da dung 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa so so'i skye bor 'dod do //
translated: but is still an ordinary being who has not attained the ārya path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul mthun pa 'dzam bu'i gling na yang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul mthun pa 'dzam bu'i gling na yang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor du gyur pa yin no //
translated: According to the Pāramitā tradition, he is a member of the retinue of the Bhagavat Śākyamuni in Jambudvīpa.

original: 'og min na yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi nye ba'i sras su gyur ba yin zhe'o //
analyzed: 'og min na yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi nye ba'i sras su gyur ba yin zhe'o //
translated: And in Akaniṣṭha, he is the son of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: mdo sde zab mo'i tshul las ni /
analyzed: mdo sde zab mo'i tshul las ni /
translated: According to the tradition of the profound sūtras,

original: sngon gyi dus su sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi dus su sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: he is a buddha of the past

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul du bzhugs pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul du bzhugs pa'o zhe'o //
translated: who abides in the manner of a bodhisattva.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshul kha cig las rigs kyi gtso bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor las sprul pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul du bzhugs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshul kha cig las rigs kyi gtso bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor las sprul pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul du bzhugs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: In some ways of secret mantra, it is asserted that he is the principal of the families, existing in the manner of a bodhisattva emanated from the uṣṇīṣa of the tathāgata.

original: rnal 'byor gyi tshul kha cig las ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs las sprul pa'i ye shes kyi sems dpa' chen po bcu drug las rdo rje rnon po ste 'jam dpal rdo rje zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi tshul kha cig las ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs las sprul pa'i ye shes kyi sems dpa' chen po bcu drug las rdo rje rnon po ste 'jam dpal rdo rje zhes 'dod do //
translated: In some ways of yoga, it is asserted that Mañjuvajra is the vajra sharpness, the great wisdom being emanated from the mind of Bhagavān Vairocana.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i tshul kha cig las ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i tshul kha cig las ni /
translated: In some ways of great yoga,

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' zhes kyang @200b bya ;
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' zhes kyang @200b bya ;
translated: Mañjuśrī is also called the wisdom being,

original: byang sems rdo rje zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: byang sems rdo rje zhes kyang bya /
translated: also called the bodhisattva vajra.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' dang / kun du bzang po dang / bde ba chen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gtso bo dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi mnga' bdag nyid du yang bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' dang / kun du bzang po dang / bde ba chen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gtso bo dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi mnga' bdag nyid du yang bstan to //
translated: Similarly, he is also taught as the principal of all buddhas, such as Vajrasattva, Samantabhadra, and Mahāsukha, and as the lord of all maṇḍalas.

original: 'jam dpal gyi sgyu 'phrul dra ba las ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kan 'jam pa'i rdo rje bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi sgyu 'phrul dra ba las ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kan 'jam pa'i rdo rje bzhugs te /
translated: The Net of Illusion of Manjushri states that Manjushrivajra resides in the heart of all tathagatas.

original: de yang dang po'i sangs rgyas gyi tshul dang / ye shes sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs so zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang dang po'i sangs rgyas gyi tshul dang / ye shes sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs so zhes 'dod do //
translated: He is said to abide in the manner of the primordial buddha and in the manner of the wisdom being.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi bdag nyid bstan pa'o //🔽'phags pa 'jam dpal de'i mtshan ni gang dang gang rnams yin zhe na ji srid du zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi bdag nyid bstan pa'o // 'phags pa 'jam dpal de'i mtshan ni gang dang gang rnams yin zhe na ji srid du zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos sam /
translated: These are the teachings on the nature of the noble Manjushri.🔽What are the names of the noble Manjushri?

original: zag pa med pa'i chos sam /🔽de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos sam / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: As long as there are phenomena, whether they are with or without defilements,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am / 'dus byas sam /
translated: whether they are mundane or supramundane,

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: whether they are compounded or uncompounded,

original: dngos po'am / dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po'am / dngos po med pa'am /
translated: whether they are things or nonthings,

original: sems sam sems snang pa la sogs te ;
analyzed: sems sam sems snang pa la sogs te ;
translated: whether they are mind or mental appearances, and so forth,

original: ji srid du chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i ming du grags pa'am /
analyzed: ji srid du chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i ming du grags pa'am /
translated: as long as there are the names that are known as the classifications of phenomena,

original: 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag las grags pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag las grags pa'am /
translated: whether they are known in the mundane treatises or in the supramundane treatises,

original: theg pa chung ngu las grags pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu las grags pa'am /
translated: Whether they are known in the Lesser Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po las grags pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las grags pa'am /
translated: or in the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po'i yang chen po gsang sngags kyi tshul las grags pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i yang chen po gsang sngags kyi tshul las grags pa yang rung ste /
translated: or in the very great vehicle of the Secret Mantra,

original: chos rnams kyi ming ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan du ma gyur pa med de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ming ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan du ma gyur pa med de /
translated: there is not a single name of a phenomenon that is not a name of the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: de bas na de dag thams cad mtshan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag thams cad mtshan du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all of them should be known as his names.

original: 'dir dris pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ming rnams ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan du rung ste /🔽'phags pa 'jam dpal nyid zag pa med pa thob pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rung na /
analyzed: 'dir dris pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ming rnams ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan du rung ste / 'phags pa 'jam dpal nyid zag pa med pa thob pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rung na /
translated: Here, one may ask, “The names of the uncontaminated phenomena are suitable as names of the noble Mañjuśrī,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams de'i mtshan du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams de'i mtshan du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: because the noble Mañjuśrī himself is the embodiment of the attainment of the uncontaminated. But how can the contaminated phenomena be his names?”

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag pa'i chos thams cad yongs su zad pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi ming de'i mtshan du mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag pa'i chos thams cad yongs su zad pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi ming de'i mtshan du mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: But it is not suitable to call him by the name of those because the noble Manjusri is the embodiment of the complete exhaustion of all defiled phenomena.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid can yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid can yin mod kyi /
translated: The noble Manjusri is indeed the embodiment of undefiled phenomena.

original: tshul 'di la 'gal ba med de /🔽'di ltar 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir dang / der 'khrul @201a * //
analyzed: tshul 'di la 'gal ba med de / 'di ltar 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir dang / der 'khrul @201a * //
translated: But there is no contradiction in this method because,

original: pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la dga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de gsung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la mnga' brnyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la dga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de gsung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la mnga' brnyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: in this way, the noble Manjusri is the nature of defiled phenomena, he pervades them, he is mistaken for them, he delights in them, he knows them, he teaches them, he is completely pure of them, and he has attained mastery over them.

original: de las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshul bcu po 'di ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshul bcu po 'di ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these ten modes are the nature of all phenomena of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: de la ji ltar de chos thams cad rang bzhin nam /🔽bdag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar de chos thams cad rang bzhin nam / bdag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the nature or essence of all phenomena?

original: 'di nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the same text:🔽The supreme nature of all things,

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
translated: the nature of all things is held.

original: skye med chos te sna tshogs don //
analyzed: skye med chos te sna tshogs don //
translated: The meaning of various phenomena is nonarising.

original: chos kun ngo bo nyid 'chang ba //
analyzed: chos kun ngo bo nyid 'chang ba //
translated: It holds the essence of all phenomena.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang / rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang / rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can //
translated: And: Having the form of various consciousnesses,

original: rnam shes sna tshogs rgyud dang ldan //
analyzed: rnam shes sna tshogs rgyud dang ldan //
translated: it is endowed with the continuum of various consciousnesses.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi //
translated: And: It is the pacification of the suffering of the three sufferings.

original: zhes pa dang / rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
translated: And: The meaning of the ten aspects is the meaning of the ten.

original: zhes pa dang / don grub bsam pa 'grub pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / don grub bsam pa 'grub pa ste //
translated: And: The accomplishment of the meaning is the accomplishment of thought.

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: It is the abandonment of all conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i skabs su bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i skabs su bshad pa /
translated: In the context of the above statements,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'o zhes bshad pa dang / gzhan yang rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can gyi skabs su /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'o zhes bshad pa dang / gzhan yang rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can gyi skabs su /
translated: the essence of all things is explained, and in the context of the various forms and objects of cognition,🔽it is explained that Mañjuśrī is the nature of mind, thought, and cognition, together with appearances.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par rig pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal lo zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi'i skabs su sdug bsngal gsum ni sdug bsngal nyid du bshad la /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par rig pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal lo zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi'i skabs su sdug bsngal gsum ni sdug bsngal nyid du bshad la /
translated: Similarly, in the context of the pacification of the suffering of the three sufferings, the three sufferings are explained as suffering,

original: yang sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i kun 'byung du bshad /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i kun 'byung du bshad /
translated: and again, suffering is explained as the origin that produces suffering,

original: zhi ba 'gog par bshad de /
analyzed: zhi ba 'gog par bshad de /
translated: and pacification is explained as cessation.🔽And it is explained that these are also the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: de dag kyang 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin par bshad pa dang / rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i skabs su bdag tu lta ba rnam pa bcu bshad la /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin par bshad pa dang / rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i skabs su bdag tu lta ba rnam pa bcu bshad la /
translated: In the context of the ten aspects and ten objects, the ten views of self are explained,

original: yang don ni gnyen po rnam pa bcu bshad de /
analyzed: yang don ni gnyen po rnam pa bcu bshad de /
translated: and again, object is explained as the ten antidotes.

original: de ltar na mi mthun pa dang gnyen po de /
analyzed: de ltar na mi mthun pa dang gnyen po de /
translated: In this way, the discordant and the antidote

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal lo zhes bshad pa lta bu la sogs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal lo zhes bshad pa lta bu la sogs pa /
translated: are explained to be noble Mañjuśrī.

original: chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is explained that noble Mañjuśrī is the nature of all phenomena,

original: de lta bu yon tan brjod pa'i mi thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu yon tan brjod pa'i mi thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: in that way, all those who speak of qualities are also his name.

original: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal ji ltar na chos thams cad la khyab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal ji ltar na chos thams cad la khyab pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that regard, it may be asked, “How is noble Mañjuśrī all-pervading in all phenomena?”

original: @201b 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: @201b 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: mi 'gyur kun 'gro khyab pa po //
analyzed: mi 'gyur kun 'gro khyab pa po //
translated: The unchanging, all-pervading, and pervasive

original: zhe 'am / sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
analyzed: zhe 'am / sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
translated: Abides in the mind of all buddhas.

original: zhes gsungs / sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs / sems can kun gyi yid la gnas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Abides in the mind of all sentient beings.

original: de la rnam pa bzhi'i tshul gyis khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhi'i tshul gyis khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In that regard, the pervasiveness by way of four aspects is as follows:

original: chos nyid dang / ye shes dang / thugs rje dang / mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid dang / ye shes dang / thugs rje dang / mdzad pa'o //
translated: Dharmatā, pristine consciousness, compassion, and activity.

original: de la chos nyid kyis khyab pa ni chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ba bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyid kyis khyab pa ni chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ba bdag med pa ste /
translated: The pervasion by reality is that all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature, selfless.

original: 'di ltar gzhan las /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan las /
translated: As it is said elsewhere:

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from the realm of reality,

original: chos ni 'ga' yang yod ma yin //🔽gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'ga' yang yod ma yin // gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: there is no phenomenon at all.

original: de bas na chos kyi dbyings ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi dbyings ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal te /
translated: Therefore, the realm of reality is the noble Mañjuśrī,

original: de'i phyir thams cad la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad la khyab pa'o //
translated: and for that reason it pervades everything.

original: ye shes kyi sgo nas khyab ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgo nas khyab ste /
translated: It is pervaded by gnosis,

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi chos can ni rang rig pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi chos can ni rang rig pa tsam ste /
translated: because the subject of the realm of reality is mere self-awareness,

original: chos thams cad kyang rang rig pa tsam du 'dus pa dang / ye shes kyi yul du ma gyur ba'i chos nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rang rig pa tsam du 'dus pa dang / ye shes kyi yul du ma gyur ba'i chos nyid kyang med de /
translated: and all phenomena are included in mere self-awareness, and there is no reality that is not the object of gnosis.

original: de'i phyir ye shes kyi tshul gyis kyang khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes kyi tshul gyis kyang khyab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also pervaded by the mode of gnosis.

original: thugs rjes kyang bya ba ste /
analyzed: thugs rjes kyang bya ba ste /
translated: It is also pervaded by compassion,

original: ji ltar dbyings dang ye shes zung du 'brel pa gang na bden thugs rje chen po yang rgyun mi 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyings dang ye shes zung du 'brel pa gang na bden thugs rje chen po yang rgyun mi 'chad pa yin no //
translated: because wherever there is the union of the realm and gnosis, there is also the uninterrupted great compassion.

original: de bzhin du mdzad pas kyang khyab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzad pas kyang khyab ste /
translated: And likewise, his deeds pervade them.

original: chos de gsum gang du tshogs pa der mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: chos de gsum gang du tshogs pa der mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: Wherever these three dharmas are found, his deeds are uninterrupted.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs dang sems can rnams kyi sems la 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis khyab ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs dang sems can rnams kyi sems la 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis khyab ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind of the buddhas and the minds of sentient beings are pervaded by the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: chos de dag gang nas ma 'ongs //
analyzed: chos de dag gang nas ma 'ongs //
translated: These dharmas do not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro //
translated: nor do they go anywhere,🔽nor do they abide anywhere.

original: gar yang gnas par 'gyur ba med bzhin du skal ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi don mdzad par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gar yang gnas par 'gyur ba med bzhin du skal ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi don mdzad par nus pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, they are able to benefit sentient beings in accordance with their fortune and interest.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: All names that express such qualities are his names.

original: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal ji ltar na chos thams cad du sbrul pa yin zhe na 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa 'jam dpal ji ltar na chos thams cad du sbrul pa yin zhe na 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: In that regard, how is it that the noble Mañjuśrī is an emanation in all dharmas? It is stated here:

original: gzugs rnams ma lus snang ba'i dpal //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma lus snang ba'i dpal //
translated: The glory of the appearance of all forms,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //
translated: having various forms, born from the mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dbang gis snod dang bcud du bcas pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su sbrul pa dang / gtsug phud phud bu lcang lo can //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dbang gis snod dang bcud du bcas pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su sbrul pa dang / gtsug phud phud bu lcang lo can //
translated: He emanates the topknot, the braid, the curls,

original: ral pa mu nydza cod pan thogs //
analyzed: ral pa mu nydza cod pan thogs //
translated: the matted hair, the turban, the crown.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su brtul zhugs thams cad 'dzin par sbrul pa dang / @202a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su brtul zhugs thams cad 'dzin par sbrul pa dang / @202a * //
translated: In this way, he emanates the observance of all the ascetic practices.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa 'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa 'am /
translated: The characteristics of his form are as follows: He is either in the enjoyment body or the emanation body.🔽He is either a bodhisattva,

original: sprul pa'am / byang chub sems dpa'am /🔽rang rgyal ba'am /
analyzed: sprul pa'am / byang chub sems dpa'am / rang rgyal ba'am /
translated: a pratyekabuddha,

original: nyan thos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos sam /
translated: a śrāvaka,

original: skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa'am /
translated: or the lord of beings, and so on.

original: gzhan yang mdzes pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdzes pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: He is also a beautiful form,

original: mi sdug pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: or an ugly form,

original: rgan po'am / gzhon pa la sogs pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: rgan po'am / gzhon pa la sogs pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: or the form of an old man, a young man, and so on.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: He is also the form of one with afflictions,

original: zag pa zad pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan du 'phags pa 'jam dpal mi 'phrul pa med do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan du 'phags pa 'jam dpal mi 'phrul pa med do //
translated: or the form of one who has exhausted the defilements, and so on. He is the reflection of all dharmas. There is no ārya Mañjuśrī who does not emanate.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all names that express such qualities are also his epithets.

original: de la ji ltar na 'phags pa 'jam dpal de chos thams cad la dga' ba yin zhe na 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'phags pa 'jam dpal de chos thams cad la dga' ba yin zhe na 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: How is it that the noble Mañjuśrī delights in all dharmas? It is stated here:

original: dngos don ma lus rnams la dga' //
analyzed: dngos don ma lus rnams la dga' //
translated: He delights in all things without exception.

original: stong pa nyid dga' 'dod chags blo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dga' 'dod chags blo //
translated: He delights in emptiness, has a mind of attachment,

original: srid gsum dga' ba chen po pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: srid gsum dga' ba chen po pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: And is greatly delighted in the three existences.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dbang gis chos thams cad dga' bar ston pa dang / snying rje'i dbang gis srid pa la chags pa'i yid dga' ba dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis stong pa nyid la chags shing dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dbang gis chos thams cad dga' bar ston pa dang / snying rje'i dbang gis srid pa la chags pa'i yid dga' ba dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis stong pa nyid la chags shing dga' ba ste /
translated: As stated, he teaches all dharmas with delight due to his mastery in guiding beings, delights in the mind attached to existence due to his compassion, and delights in attachment to emptiness due to his wisdom.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i yon tan gyi dbang du gsungs pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i yon tan gyi dbang du gsungs pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all names stated from the perspective of such qualities are also his epithets.

original: de la ji ltar na chos thams cad mkhyen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na chos thams cad mkhyen pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he knows all dharmas?

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said in this very sūtra:

original: shes rab chen pos skad cig la //🔽chos kun khong du chud pa po //
analyzed: shes rab chen pos skad cig la // chos kun khong du chud pa po //
translated: With great wisdom, in an instant,🔽he comprehends all phenomena.

original: chos kun mngon par rtogs pa po //
analyzed: chos kun mngon par rtogs pa po //
translated: He realizes all phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du chos thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dbang du gsungs pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du chos thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dbang du gsungs pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all the names taught in the context of demonstrating the qualities of omniscience over all phenomena become his epithets.

original: de la ji ltar na chos thams cad gsungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na chos thams cad gsungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he is said to teach all phenomena?

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /🔽smra ba'i skyes mchog smra ba'i rgyal //
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa / smra ba'i skyes mchog smra ba'i rgyal //
translated: It is said in this very sūtra:🔽Supreme speaker, king of speakers,

original: smra ba'i dam pa mchog gi gnas //
analyzed: smra ba'i dam pa mchog gi gnas //
translated: sublime, supreme abode of speakers,

original: smra ba'i seng ge tshugs pa med //
analyzed: smra ba'i seng ge tshugs pa med //
translated: lion of speakers, unassailable.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, and so forth.

original: ji srid du chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i mnga' bdag yin pas /
analyzed: ji srid du chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i mnga' bdag yin pas /
translated: As long as he is the master of unerringly teaching all phenomena,

original: de'i dbang du smos pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming yang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang du smos pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming yang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: all the names of phenomena taught in that context become his epithets.

original: de la ji ltar na de chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i @202b bdag nyid can yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i @202b bdag nyid can yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Buddha has the nature of the purity of all phenomena?

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: It is taught here:

original: zag pa zad pa dang / sgrib pa las grol ba dang / nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa dang / srid pa 'joms pa dang / 'khor ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chu bo las rgal ba dang / srid rtsa bton pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi dri ma dag pa'i sgo nas brjod pa dang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa dang / sgrib pa las grol ba dang / nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa dang / srid pa 'joms pa dang / 'khor ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chu bo las rgal ba dang / srid rtsa bton pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi dri ma dag pa'i sgo nas brjod pa dang /
translated: The elimination of defilements, freedom from obscurations, the pacification of afflictions, the destruction of existence, the transcendence of saṃsāra, crossing the rivers, uprooting existence, and so forth are expressed from the perspective of the purity of defiled phenomena.

original: gzhan dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ba dang / rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba /
analyzed: gzhan dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ba dang / rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba /
translated: The Buddha possesses the other twelve purities and the five pure aggregates.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dag pa dang / shes ba bcu rnam dag 'chang ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dag pa dang / shes ba bcu rnam dag 'chang ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He possesses the ten perfections, the ten knowledges, and so forth.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang mthar phyin pa'i sgo nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du ston te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang mthar phyin pa'i sgo nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du ston te /
translated: The uncontaminated phenomena are also taught to have the characteristic of utter purity from the perspective of their culmination.

original: de ltar chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i yon tan ston pa'i ming gang smos pa thams cad de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i yon tan ston pa'i ming gang smos pa thams cad de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all the names that teach the pure qualities of all phenomena become his names.

original: de la ji ltar na de chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin zhe na /
translated: In this regard, how is he the lord of all phenomena?

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes shing /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal // zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes shing /
translated: The lord of phenomena, the king of phenomena,🔽and so on.🔽All the names that express his qualities through teaching that he has attained mastery over all phenomena,

original: de la dbang sgyur ba chos kyi rgyal po dang / gtso bo dang / bdag po ston pa'i sgo nas yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dbang sgyur ba chos kyi rgyal po dang / gtso bo dang / bdag po ston pa'i sgo nas yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: that he rules over them, that he is the king of phenomena, the principal one, and the lord, become his names.

original: de la ji ltar na de chos thams cad skyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de chos thams cad skyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: In this regard, how is he the producer of all phenomena?

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: The producer of all buddhas,

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pa //
translated: the single cause of the great elements,

original: sna tshogs don kun skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs don kun skyed pa'o //
translated: the producer of all diverse meanings,

original: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //
analyzed: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //
translated: the producer of all the meanings of secret mantra,

original: la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'phags pa 'jam dpal las byung bar ston pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'phags pa 'jam dpal las byung bar ston pa lta bu ste /
translated: and so on, all phenomena arise from the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad skyed pa yin pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa yin pa dang / 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir sprul pa thams cad skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad skyed pa yin pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa yin pa dang / 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir sprul pa thams cad skyed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he is the producer of all phenomena because of suchness, the producer of all buddhas because of method and wisdom, and the producer of all emanations because of the power of disciples.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa yon tan brjod pa'i phyir smos pa'i ming thams cad de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa yon tan brjod pa'i phyir smos pa'i ming thams cad de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all names that are mentioned for the sake of expressing such qualities and so on are his names.

original: de la ji ltar de chos thams cad las skyes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar de chos thams cad las skyes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he is born from all phenomena?🔽He is born from reality.

original: de chos nyid las skyes pa yin zhes ste /
analyzed: de chos nyid las skyes pa yin zhes ste /
translated: It is said:

original: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Self-arisen, arisen from space.🔽He is born from wisdom alone.

original: de la ye shes 'ba' zhig las skyes pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes 'ba' zhig las skyes pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is said:

original: de sems las skyes pa @203a * //
analyzed: de sems las skyes pa @203a * //
translated: He is born from mind.🔽It is said:

original: yin te / sna tshogs gzugs can yid la skyes //
analyzed: yin te / sna tshogs gzugs can yid la skyes //
translated: Born in the mind, having various forms.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,

original: de nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam thams cad las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam thams cad las skyes pa yin te /
translated: It is born from all the paths of the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the perfectly enlightened buddhas.🔽As it is said,

original: des 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba /🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba / zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It arises from the various elements.

original: de theg pa chen po'i yang chen po //
analyzed: de theg pa chen po'i yang chen po //
translated: It is the greatest of the great of the Mahāyāna.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshul las kyang skyes pa yin te /🔽gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshul las kyang skyes pa yin te / gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //
translated: It is also born from the way of secret mantra.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,🔽It arises from the great way of secret mantra.

original: de legs par spyad pa'i chos las kyis skyes pa yin te /🔽chos las byung ba srid pa sel //
analyzed: de legs par spyad pa'i chos las kyis skyes pa yin te / chos las byung ba srid pa sel //
translated: It is born from the Dharma of good conduct.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,🔽It arises from the Dharma and dispels existence.

original: de chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid las skyes pa yin te /
translated: It is born from the characteristic of the inseparability of all phenomena.🔽As it is said,

original: rdo rje las skyes rdo rje'i bdag //🔽ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las skyes rdo rje'i bdag //🔽ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: Born from the vajra, the lord of the vajra.

original: de ltar chos thams cad las skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir de'i yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad las skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir de'i yon tan brjod pa'i ming thams cad kyang de'i mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate that he is born from all phenomena, all names expressing his qualities are also his name.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu'i sgo nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming thams cad de'i mtshan du 'gyur ba thun mong du 'gyur ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu'i sgo nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming thams cad de'i mtshan du 'gyur ba thun mong du 'gyur ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus demonstrated in a general way that all names of all phenomena, both contaminated and uncontaminated, are his name in terms of these ten aspects,

original: da ni khyad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni khyad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: now he will speak of their particularities.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la de'i bdag nyid du ston pa'i tshe //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la de'i bdag nyid du ston pa'i tshe //
translated: In this regard, when the contaminated phenomena are taught to be his nature,

original: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: it should be said that the characteristics of contaminated phenomena

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: are the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that the characteristics of the noble Mañjuśrī are contaminated.

original: dper na bum pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, it should be said that🔽the characteristics of a vase are uncontaminated.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni bum pa'o zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni bum pa'o zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of impermanence should not be said to be a pot.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi rnam par gzhag pa ni khyab pa che chung dang / phra rags dang dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa dang / 'khrul pa dang bden pa lta bu'i sgo nas phan tshun bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi rnam par gzhag pa ni khyab pa che chung dang / phra rags dang dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa dang / 'khrul pa dang bden pa lta bu'i sgo nas phan tshun bzhag ste /
translated: Thus, the presentation of characteristics and characterized bases is established by mutual dependence in terms of the gross and subtle, the coarse and fine, the true and false, and so on.

original: thams cad du phan tshun nor du rung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du phan tshun nor du rung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But not everything is mutually suitable.

original: de bas na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos yin par mi brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos yin par mi brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not said that the characteristic of the noble Mañjuśrī is a contaminated phenomenon.

original: chos thams cad khyab par ston pa'i skabs su rten dang brten par gzhag pa'i tshe 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag bcas kyi chos la khyab pa yin gyi brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad khyab par ston pa'i skabs su rten dang brten par gzhag pa'i tshe 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni zag bcas kyi chos la khyab pa yin gyi brten pa ma yin no //
translated: When presenting the pervasion of all phenomena as the supported and the basis as the support, the noble Mañjuśrī pervades contaminated phenomena but is not supported by them.

original: dper na nam @203b mkha' ni gzugs la khyab pa yin gyi brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam @203b mkha' ni gzugs la khyab pa yin gyi brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, space pervades form but is not supported by it.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni gzugs la khyab pa yin kyang nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gzugs la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni gzugs la khyab pa yin kyang nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gzugs la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, space pervades forms, but the characteristic of space is not based on forms.

original: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la 'phags pa 'jam dpal brten pa'i tshul nas mtshan mi brjod do ;
analyzed: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la 'phags pa 'jam dpal brten pa'i tshul nas mtshan mi brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, the noble Mañjuśrī does not speak of characteristics in terms of being based on contaminated phenomena.

original: / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos lta bur sprul zhing 'jug par ston pa'i tshe /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la thugs rje dang 'phrul pa 'jug par ston kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la ni des bsgos shing byin gyis rlob kyi /
analyzed: / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos lta bur sprul zhing 'jug par ston pa'i tshe / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la thugs rje dang 'phrul pa 'jug par ston kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la ni des bsgos shing byin gyis rlob kyi /
translated: When he manifests and engages in emanations that are like contaminated phenomena,

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pas mi 'dzin cing mi gos te ;
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pas mi 'dzin cing mi gos te ;
translated: he manifests the engagement of compassion and emanations in contaminated phenomena. However, he is not affected by or fixated on contaminated phenomena.

original: / dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mi gtsang ba'i sa phyogs su shar ba'i tshe nyi ma'i 'od kyis mi gtsang ba'i sa phyogs su bsgos shing reg par gyur kyang /
analyzed: / dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mi gtsang ba'i sa phyogs su shar ba'i tshe nyi ma'i 'od kyis mi gtsang ba'i sa phyogs su bsgos shing reg par gyur kyang /
translated: For example, when the sun’s rays shine on an impure place, the sun’s light touches and pervades the impure place.

original: dri ma des 'od la bsgos shing byin gyis brlab pa med do //
analyzed: dri ma des 'od la bsgos shing byin gyis brlab pa med do //
translated: However, the light is not affected or influenced by those stains.

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'jug pas kyang gos pa'i tshul nas mtshan brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'jug pas kyang gos pa'i tshul nas mtshan brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not refer to him by the name of a defiled phenomenon.

original: tshul de dag gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang ldan par bsgrubs pa ni 'gal ba med kyi /
analyzed: tshul de dag gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang ldan par bsgrubs pa ni 'gal ba med kyi /
translated: In these ways, it is not contradictory to establish that the noble Mañjuśrī possesses defiled phenomena.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs ldan pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs ldan pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: However, one should not refer to the noble Mañjuśrī by the name of a defiled phenomenon.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod pa'i tshe //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod pa'i tshe //
translated: When referring to him by name from the perspective of purity,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni nyes skyon kyi chos dri ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de bsal zhing zad par byas pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni nyes skyon kyi chos dri ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de bsal zhing zad par byas pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod pa yin no //
translated: defiled phenomena are characterized by the faults of stains. Therefore, one refers to him by name from the perspective of eliminating and exhausting those.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnam par dag par ston pa'i tshe ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnam par dag par ston pa'i tshe ni /
translated: When teaching the purity of undefiled phenomena,

original: de la mi mthun pa'i dri ma thams cad ma lus par gtan du rin  pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i mtshan brjod pa dang / don dam par gnyis su med pa'i tshul nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i dri ma thams cad ma lus par gtan du rin  pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i mtshan brjod pa dang / don dam par gnyis su med pa'i tshul nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: The name of the pure one is expressed in the sense of being forever free of all stains that are incompatible with it, and in the sense of being ultimately nondual.

original: kun rdzob tsam du de dag spang par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du de dag spang par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since it is only on the conventional level that they are to be abandoned,

original: spangs shing zad par bya ba'i tshul ni brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spangs shing zad par bya ba'i tshul ni brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: the way in which they are to be abandoned and exhausted is not expressed.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos bskyed par ston pa'i tshe ;
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos bskyed par ston pa'i tshe ;
translated: When it is taught that it produces defiled phenomena,

original: chos ci yang ma yin pa dang / shes pa rang rig pa'i sgo nas 'khrul ba'i chos sna tshogs su snang ba'i bdag po'i rkyen du bshad kyi rgyu'i rkyen du mi brjod do //
analyzed: chos ci yang ma yin pa dang / shes pa rang rig pa'i sgo nas 'khrul ba'i chos sna tshogs su snang ba'i bdag po'i rkyen du bshad kyi rgyu'i rkyen du mi brjod do //
translated: it is explained as the dominant condition for the appearance of the various deluded phenomena through the door of reflexive awareness, but it is not said to be the causal condition.

original: de chos thams cad las skyes par bstan pa'i skabs su /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi dbang las 'phags pa 'jam @204a * //
analyzed: de chos thams cad las skyes par bstan pa'i skabs su / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi dbang las 'phags pa 'jam @204a * //
translated: When it is taught that it is produced by all phenomena,

original: dpal skye bar bshad kyi de'i rgyu rkyen yin par mi bshad de /
analyzed: dpal skye bar bshad kyi de'i rgyu rkyen yin par mi bshad de /
translated: it is explained that the noble Mañjuśrī is born from the power of defiled phenomena, but it is not explained that he is their cause.

original: de bas na de de dag gi sgo nas mtshan brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de de dag gi sgo nas mtshan brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the name should not be expressed by means of those.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos la khyad par du bstan pa ni de dag las bzlog pa nyid de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos la khyad par du bstan pa ni de dag las bzlog pa nyid de /
translated: The explanation of the distinction of uncontaminated phenomena is the opposite of those.

original: zag med kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid can dang / chos la brten pa dang / chos kyis bsgos shing byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas kyang mtshan brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zag med kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid can dang / chos la brten pa dang / chos kyis bsgos shing byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas kyang mtshan brjod pa yin te /
translated: The name is expressed by means of the characteristics of uncontaminated phenomena, by means of being based on phenomena, and by means of being imbued with and empowered by phenomena and so on.

original: 'di dag ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan du bstan pa las brjod pa'i tshul gyi sgo nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos la thun mong du mtshan brjod du rung ba dang / bye brag gi sgo nas brjod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan du bstan pa las brjod pa'i tshul gyi sgo nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos la thun mong du mtshan brjod du rung ba dang / bye brag gi sgo nas brjod pa dang /
translated: These are the general and specific ways of expressing the name of contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena from the perspective of the mode of expression in the teaching of the characteristics of all phenomena.

original: brjod pa ma yin pa yod par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ma yin pa yod par bstan pa ste /
translated: The existence of inexpressible names is also taught.

original: 'di dag tsam gyis de'i mtshan gang dang gang rnams yin pa mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag tsam gyis de'i mtshan gang dang gang rnams yin pa mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a brief explanation of which names are which.

original: rgyas par ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi skabs su bstan pa'i mtshan rnams yan lag dang nying lag tu phye ba de'i mtshan rnams yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi skabs su bstan pa'i mtshan rnams yan lag dang nying lag tu phye ba de'i mtshan rnams yin no //
translated: The extensive [explanation] is the names taught in this very treatise, divided into major and minor parts.

original: da ni de yang dag par ji ltar brjod pa'i tshul bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de yang dag par ji ltar brjod pa'i tshul bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the correct way to express those [names].

original: de yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, there are three [ways].

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di ltar mtshan yon tan gyi don du bltas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan yon tan gyi don du bltas te /
translated: Thus, viewing the names as having the meaning of qualities,

original: brjod pa'i tshul dang / mtshan gsang sngags kyi tshul du bltas te brjod pa'i tshul dang / mtshan gnyis su med pa'i don du bltas te brjod pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshul dang / mtshan gsang sngags kyi tshul du bltas te brjod pa'i tshul dang / mtshan gnyis su med pa'i don du bltas te brjod pa'i tshul lo //
translated: the way of expressing [them], viewing the names as having the meaning of secret mantra, the way of expressing [them], and viewing the names as having the meaning of non-duality, the way of expressing [them].

original: de la mtshan yon tan gyi don du bltas te brjod pa'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan yon tan gyi don du bltas te brjod pa'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the way of expressing [them] by viewing the names as having the meaning of qualities?

original: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing theg pa chen po'i sgor zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing theg pa chen po'i sgor zhugs pa /
translated: Here, any son or daughter of good family who has given rise to the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and entered the gateway of the Mahāyāna,

original: sangs rgyas la shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis thog ma nyid du bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ni phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid chen po de dag thams cad kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang
analyzed: sangs rgyas la shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis thog ma nyid du bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ni phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid chen po de dag thams cad kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang
translated: Those who have faith in the Buddha, having understood him, should first of all know that the Bhagavān Mañjuśrījñānasattva is the great being of all the tathāgatas of the ten directions, endowed with all their perfect qualities.

original: ldan pa / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs rje dang mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mtha' klas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa sgrub cing /
analyzed: ldan pa / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs rje dang mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mtha' klas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa sgrub cing /
translated: He is endowed with the uninterrupted compassion and activity of all the buddhas, and he accomplishes the intention of all the buddhas, who fill the reaches of space.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams cad kyi re ba yongs su skong ba'i phrin las mdzad pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams cad kyi re ba yongs su skong ba'i phrin las mdzad pa /
translated: He performs the activity of fulfilling the hopes of all the realms of sentient beings without exception.

original: rtag tu sems @204b can gyi mdun du bzhugs te /
analyzed: rtag tu sems @204b can gyi mdun du bzhugs te /
translated: He always remains in the presence of sentient beings.

original: de bas gang gis 'di'i mtshan brjod pa de la ni bskal pa gang+ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan brjod pas de la dper bzod pa ma yin no zhes dang ba'i dad pa dang / mos pa sngon du byas te /
analyzed: de bas gang gis 'di'i mtshan brjod pa de la ni bskal pa gang+ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan brjod pas de la dper bzod pa ma yin no zhes dang ba'i dad pa dang / mos pa sngon du byas te /
translated: Therefore, the one who recites his name will not be able to compare it to the recitation of the names of all the buddhas for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: de yang sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir brjod par bya'o zhes smon lam gyi 'phangs pa'i bsam pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir brjod par bya'o zhes smon lam gyi 'phangs pa'i bsam pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: With such a lofty aspiration, having generated the mind of enlightenment, one should recite the name of Manjushri.

original: de yang mos pa'i dbang gis 'di ltar yid la byed pas gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang mos pa'i dbang gis 'di ltar yid la byed pas gzhag par bya ste /
translated: One should also establish this by means of mental attention, under the power of interest.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ni 'di lta bu'i yon tan can rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje dang / byams pa'i mnga' bdag la /

translated: The Bhagavat Manjushri, the wisdom being, is endowed with such qualities, with the wisdom of omniscience, with compassion, and with love.

original: rtag tu gdul bya thams cad kyi mdun na gnas pa'i phyir bdag gis de'i sku khyad par can mdun du yid la byas kyang rung /

original: ma byas kyang rung ste rtag tu mdun na gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma byas kyang rung ste rtag tu mdun na gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: But even if one does not do so, he always remains in the presence of all disciples.

original: de la brjod pa'i don du bsam pa g-yeng ba med pas mtshan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la brjod pa'i don du bsam pa g-yeng ba med pas mtshan brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should recite the names of the Buddha without distraction of mind, thinking of his meaning.

original: gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin de lta bu yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin de lta bu yin mod kyi /
translated: Otherwise, although the Bhagavat is of such a nature,

original: 'on kyang de'i gzugs bzang po khyad par can yid la byas nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i gzugs bzang po khyad par can yid la byas nas /
translated: nevertheless, one should keep in mind his special beautiful form,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhes shes par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhes shes par byas nas /
translated: and one should understand that he will bless the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: mdun gyi nam mkha' la rang gi yid las sbrul pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gyis dpag bsam gyi shing chen po rgyas pa'i grib ma la /
analyzed: mdun gyi nam mkha' la rang gi yid las sbrul pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gyis dpag bsam gyi shing chen po rgyas pa'i grib ma la /
translated: In the sky in front of oneself, one should visualize a great wish-fulfilling tree made of jewels, which grows from one's own mind, and under its spreading shade,

original: rin po che dang padma'i gdan la zla ba'i dkyil na bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nu'i sku kha ba la gur gum gtor ba lta bu sna tshogs kyi na bza' mnabs pa phyag g-yon na autpala sngon po rgyas pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: rin po che dang padma'i gdan la zla ba'i dkyil na bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nu'i sku kha ba la gur gum gtor ba lta bu sna tshogs kyi na bza' mnabs pa phyag g-yon na autpala sngon po rgyas pa bsnams pa /
translated: On a jeweled and lotus seat, upon a moon-disc, is the Bhagavat, the youthful Manjusri, his body like snow on which saffron has been sprinkled, wearing variegated garments,🔽holding in his left hand an open blue lotus,

original: g-yas pa mchog spyin can /
analyzed: g-yas pa mchog spyin can /
translated: and in his right hand a boon-granting (mudra).

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chos pa ltar rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bsam ste ;
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chos pa ltar rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bsam ste ;
translated: Like a Dharma-observing universal monarch, he is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: de'i mtshan mngon par brjod pa'i don g-yeng ba med pa'i yid la byed pas mtshan brjod par bya'o //🔽yang ma sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni glegs bam dang / ral gri dang chos 'chad pa la sogs pa dang / zla ba'i kha dog dang / gser btso ma'i kha dog la sogs te ji @205a * //
analyzed: de'i mtshan mngon par brjod pa'i don g-yeng ba med pa'i yid la byed pas mtshan brjod par bya'o // yang ma sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni glegs bam dang / ral gri dang chos 'chad pa la sogs pa dang / zla ba'i kha dog dang / gser btso ma'i kha dog la sogs te ji @205a * //
translated: With a mind free from distraction, one should recite the Manjusri-nama-samgiti, which is the meaning of his name.🔽One should also visualize his color and hand-implements, such as the scripture, sword, teaching Dharma, etc.,

original: ltar mos pa bzhin du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: ltar mos pa bzhin du yid la bya'o //

original: mchod pa brjod nas 'dod pa'i don la gsol ba btab pa ste /
analyzed: mchod pa brjod nas 'dod pa'i don la gsol ba btab pa ste /

analyzed: yongs su bdag pa'i zhing khams su gsol nas ldang bar bya'o //

analyzed: yang na 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'di ltar bsam par bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, by the power of discipline, one should contemplate in the following way.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid snga ma bzhin du bsams pa'i steng gi phyogs su bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu byung ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs par bsam mo //

translated: The Bhagavān is contemplated as before. Above him, in the direction of the zenith, one should contemplate all the buddhas of the ten directions, such as the Bhagavān Śākyamuni, abiding in the manner of going forth.

original: de'i g-yas kyi phyogs su byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang / kun du bzang po dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / sa'i snying po dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / sgrib pa rnam par sel ba la sogs te /
analyzed: de'i g-yas kyi phyogs su byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang / kun du bzang po dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / sa'i snying po dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / sgrib pa rnam par sel ba la sogs te /
translated: To his right, one should contemplate the bodhisattvas Maitreya, Samantabhadra, Avalokiteśvara, Vajrapāṇi, Kṣitigarbha, Ākāśagarbha, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, and so forth,

analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams khyim pa'i tshul gyis rgyan ma spangs pa'i mtshan du bzhugs par bsam mo /
translated: the bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon, abiding in the form of householders, not having abandoned the ornaments.

original: de'i g-yon phyogs su sh'a ri'i bu dang / mod gal gyi bu dang / rab 'byor dang / kun dga' bo la sogs te /
analyzed: de'i g-yon phyogs su sh'a ri'i bu dang / mod gal gyi bu dang / rab 'byor dang / kun dga' bo la sogs te /
translated: To the left of them are Shariputra, Maudgalyayana, Subhuti, Ananda, and so forth.

original: dgra bcom pa chen po rnams rab tu byung ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa chen po rnams rab tu byung ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs par bsam mo //

analyzed: de'i 'og gi phyogs su lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po la sogs te /

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po dang bcas pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kha dog dkar po rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa dang / brgya byin la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams sna tshogs pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan bsams te /

translated: the gods of Brahmakayika, and the sons of the gods of the form realm together with Mahabrahma. Think that they are white in color and adorned with all ornaments.

original: de rnams kyi mdun du bdag gis phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bdun dang ldan pa'i smon lam gyi sgo nas byang chub chen por sems bskyed nas /

translated: Think that in front of them you prostrate and generate the great mind of enlightenment through the seven branches of worship and the aspiration prayers.

analyzed: de thams cad la mchod pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan brjod par bya'o // de la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rdo rje rin po che las grub pa'i seng ge'i khri dang / rin po che padma dang / nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la mnyam pa'i skyil mo krung dang / mnyam gzhag gi phyag rgya dang /
