analyzed: ye shes drug gis ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bstan to //
translated: The six exalted wisdoms teach the exalted wisdom of non-duality.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de ni dam pa'i yi ge yin te zag pa lnga zad pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de ni dam pa'i yi ge yin te zag pa lnga zad pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That exalted wisdom of non-duality is the holy syllable, so called because it exhausts the five defilements and attains unwavering bliss.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' yin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' yin te /
translated: Then the Bhagavat is the wisdom being.

original: de ltar de ston cing sgrub pa'i gzhung gi tshogs yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar de ston cing sgrub pa'i gzhung gi tshogs yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Thus it is the collection of texts that teaches and establishes that.

original: de la mnyam pa chen po'i blos rgyu 'bras kyi sgo dbyer med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba lhun gyis grub par bya ba'i tshul gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la mnyam pa chen po'i blos rgyu 'bras kyi sgo dbyer med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba lhun gyis grub par bya ba'i tshul gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the method of naturally radiant spontaneous accomplishment, the indivisible cause and effect of the door of the great evenness of mind?

original: 'di la rnal 'byor can gang la la dag mnyam pa chen po'i sgo nas chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes shing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i 'bras bu'i chos lhun gyis grub pa rtogs shing rgyu bsgrubs pas 'bras bu 'byung ba'i dus la ltos pa med
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor can gang la la dag mnyam pa chen po'i sgo nas chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes shing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i 'bras bu'i chos lhun gyis grub pa rtogs shing rgyu bsgrubs pas 'bras bu 'byung ba'i dus la ltos pa med
translated: They do not rely on a time when the result arises from the accomplishment of the cause.

original: pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos su grags pa rnams la blang ba dang dor ba med cing /
analyzed: pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos su grags pa rnams la blang ba dang dor ba med cing /
translated: They do not accept or reject the phenomena that are renowned as thoroughly afflicted or completely pure.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu dbye ba mi 'byed pa la /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu dbye ba mi 'byed pa la /
translated: They do not make a distinction between the ultimate and the relative.🔽They do not make a distinction between the way of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du yang 'byed pa mi 'byed pa dang sems dang sems snang bas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyang 'jam dpal rdo rje'i @213b rang bzhin du rdzogs te bsam du med /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du yang 'byed pa mi 'byed pa dang sems dang sems snang bas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyang 'jam dpal rdo rje'i @213b rang bzhin du rdzogs te bsam du med /
translated: All phenomena included in the mind and mental appearances are perfect in the nature of Mañjuvajra.

original: bcol du med pa /
analyzed: bcol du med pa /
translated: They are inconceivable.🔽They are unfathomable.

original: bsgrub du med pa'i dang du rtsol ba med par lhun gyis rdzogs par gnas par 'dod pa rnams kyis thog ma nyid du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dam pa las mnyam pa chen po'i lung tshul bzhin du mnos te shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas rtogs shing
analyzed: bsgrub du med pa'i dang du rtsol ba med par lhun gyis rdzogs par gnas par 'dod pa rnams kyis thog ma nyid du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dam pa las mnyam pa chen po'i lung tshul bzhin du mnos te shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas rtogs shing
translated: Those who wish to abide in the spontaneous perfection of the great, non-conceptual, non-dual wisdom, which is free from the effort of accomplishment, should first of all receive from a holy spiritual friend the transmission of the Great Sameness.🔽

original: goms par bya'o //
analyzed: goms par bya'o //
translated: Those who wish to abide in the spontaneous perfection of the great equality of all things, without effort, without accomplishment, should first of all receive the transmission of the great equality of all things from a holy spiritual friend, and then they should understand it by means of the three kinds of wisdom and practice it.

original: yid ches pa'i dad pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i dad pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: They should generate the faith of conviction.

original: de'i stobs kyis chos gnyis su med pa dang mthun pa'i dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab rnams rgyud la skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis chos gnyis su med pa dang mthun pa'i dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab rnams rgyud la skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of that, the faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom that are in accord with the nondual Dharma will arise in their mindstreams.

original: de'i stobs kyis bdag gi lta ba ldog / bdag tu mi lta na rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis bdag gi lta ba ldog / bdag tu mi lta na rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: By the power of that, the view of self is reversed, and if one does not view a self, one will not conceptualize.

original: de'i dbang gis mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing nyams su mi myong mngon par mi zhen no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing nyams su mi myong mngon par mi zhen no //
translated: By the power of that, one will not grasp at signs, experience, or cling to them.

original: de'i dbang gis mi chags mi len te de ltar na sdug bsngal mngon par sbyor gnas med do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mi chags mi len te de ltar na sdug bsngal mngon par sbyor gnas med do //
translated: By the power of that, one will not be attached or take up, and thus one will not be engaged in suffering.

original: de bas na chos gnyis su med pa'i goms par byas /
analyzed: de bas na chos gnyis su med pa'i goms par byas /
translated: Therefore, one should cultivate the non-duality of the two realities.

original: yang dang yang du goms par byas pas ni zag pa ma lus pa byang bar 'gyur te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du goms par byas pas ni zag pa ma lus pa byang bar 'gyur te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating it again and again, one will purify all the defilements without remainder and will attain the non-dual intuition.

original: de bskyed pa'i thabs bden pa gang yin pa de phan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i thabs bden pa gang yin pa de phan pa yin no //
translated: The method for generating that is the benefit of the two realities.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ji ltar na phan pa'i bdag nyid can yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ji ltar na phan pa'i bdag nyid can yin /
translated: How can the truths of suffering and of the origin of suffering be beneficial?

original: phan pa gang yin pa de bden pa yin na mu stegs legs skyong gi rig byed kyi phan pa lta bu ji ltar bden pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: phan pa gang yin pa de bden pa yin na mu stegs legs skyong gi rig byed kyi phan pa lta bu ji ltar bden pa yin zhe na /
translated: If that which is beneficial is a truth, how can the beneficial of the non-Buddhist scriptures, such as the Rig Veda, be a truth?

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phan pa gang ji snyed pa ni bden pa yin te bden pa la phan pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phan pa gang ji snyed pa ni bden pa yin te bden pa la phan pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is beneficial as taught by the Tathagata is a truth, and whatever is a truth is beneficial.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden par gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden par gsungs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the truths of suffering and origination are said to be real in the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, etc.

original: de la de ltar dmigs shing goms par byas pa ni phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de ltar dmigs shing goms par byas pa ni phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: To focus on them in that way and to cultivate them is beneficial.

original: gnod pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par bltas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par bltas pa yin te /
translated: The characteristics of harm are the views of permanence, happiness, self, etc.

original: mi bden pa'i phyir bslus pa zhes bya'o //🔽mu stegs legs skyong rnams kyi phan pa ni /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i phyir bslus pa zhes bya'o // mu stegs legs skyong rnams kyi phan pa ni /
translated: Because they are not real, they are called “deceptive.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phan par grags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phan par grags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The benefit of the tīrthikas is not the benefit proclaimed by the Tathāgata.

original: 'on kyang phan pa de yang bden pa'i mdo @214a * //🔽las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phan pa de yang bden pa'i mdo @214a * // las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
translated: However, that benefit is not beyond the sūtras of truth.

original: yang rgal ba /
analyzed: yang rgal ba /
translated: Again, an objection is raised:

original: de ltar grub pas mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gnyis su med pa'i don brjod pa la dzi ltar phan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar grub pas mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gnyis su med pa'i don brjod pa la dzi ltar phan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “In that case, how is the recitation of the names of the Tathāgata beneficial for the expression of the meaning of nonduality in the Tathāgataguṇajñānācintyaviṣayāvatāranirdeśa?”

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that it is said:

original: de 'di ltar rgyal ba rnams kyi bka' mtha' dag phan pa dang bden pa ston pa kho na tsam yin la /
analyzed: de 'di ltar rgyal ba rnams kyi bka' mtha' dag phan pa dang bden pa ston pa kho na tsam yin la /
translated: All the words of the Victorious Ones are only teachings of benefit and truth.

original: phan pa dang bden pa ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan yin te /
analyzed: phan pa dang bden pa ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan yin te /
translated: Teaching benefit and truth is a quality of the Thus-Gone Ones.

original: yon tan thams cad bstan pa yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad bstan pa yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di yin no //
translated: The teaching of all qualities is also this ultimate true name of the Blessed One, the wisdom being Mañjuśrī.

original: de bas na yon tan thams cad kyang phan pa dang bden pa ston pa tsam yin la phan pa dang bden pa yang bdag nyid gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su bstan du med do //
analyzed: de bas na yon tan thams cad kyang phan pa dang bden pa ston pa tsam yin la phan pa dang bden pa yang bdag nyid gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su bstan du med do //
translated: Therefore, all qualities are only teachings of benefit and truth, and benefit and truth are not taught as two because they are of the same nature.

original: phan pa dang bden pa thams cad kyi dngos gzhi dang snying por gyur pa yang chos gnyis su med pa yin te /
analyzed: phan pa dang bden pa thams cad kyi dngos gzhi dang snying por gyur pa yang chos gnyis su med pa yin te /
translated: The actual basis and essence of all benefit and truth is also the nondual Dharma.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi mtshan gang ci brjod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi mtshan gang ci brjod kyang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whatever qualities of the Thus-Gone Ones are expressed,

original: de dag thams cad kyi brjod bya ni chos kyi sku yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi brjod bya ni chos kyi sku yin no //
translated: The subject matter of all of them is the Dharma Body.

original: de ltar na gnyis su med pa'i don khong du chud cing yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir mtshan brjod par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //🔽don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis su med pa'i don khong du chud cing yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir mtshan brjod par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o // don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the expression of the name is for the purpose of realizing and perfecting the meaning of non-duality.🔽The expression of the name of the ultimate is also stated in this very method.

original: tshul 'di nyid las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is called the Expression of the Names of the Ultimate.

original: de la chos gnyis su med pa rgyud la bskyed pa'i don du mtshan brjod pa gcig mod kyi gdul bya'i dbang gis sgo tha dad de /
analyzed: de la chos gnyis su med pa rgyud la bskyed pa'i don du mtshan brjod pa gcig mod kyi gdul bya'i dbang gis sgo tha dad de /
translated: There, although the expression of the name is indeed for the purpose of generating the non-dual Dharma in the mindstream, due to the power of the disciples, the doors are different.

original: de bas na 'dir sgo gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sgo gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here it should be understood as having three doors.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: chos gnyis su med par rtogs pas gang zag gi rgyu mi skye bar bya ba'i tshul dang / thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pas zab pa'i 'bras bu zag pa zad pa bzlog pas rgyu dang bcas pa bzlog par gyur pa bstan pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: chos gnyis su med par rtogs pas gang zag gi rgyu mi skye bar bya ba'i tshul dang / thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pas zab pa'i 'bras bu zag pa zad pa bzlog pas rgyu dang bcas pa bzlog par gyur pa bstan pa'i tshul dang /
translated: The method of causing the non-arising of the person's cause by realizing the non-duality of phenomena, the method of teaching the reversal of the profound result of the exhaustion of defilements along with its cause by the union of means and wisdom, and the method of teaching the reversal of the cause of the exhaustion of the lineage of the Three Jewels by the non-duality of the Dharma and the person.

original: mnyam pa chen po'i blos rgyu 'bras kyi sgo dbyer med par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bsam pa lhun gyis grub par bya ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: mnyam pa chen po'i blos rgyu 'bras kyi sgo dbyer med par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bsam pa lhun gyis grub par bya ba'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of spontaneously accomplishing the intention of the natural luminosity of the indivisible door of cause and effect with the mind of great equality.

original: de la rgyu zad par bya ba'i chos ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu zad par bya ba'i chos ni /
translated: The Dharma of exhausting the cause is as follows:

original: mtshan brjod pas chos gnyis su med pa'i yon tan brjod par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan brjod pas chos gnyis su med pa'i yon tan brjod par mos par bya'o //
translated: By reciting the name, one should imagine and remember the qualities of the non-dual Dharma,

original: dran par bya'o //
analyzed: dran par bya'o //
translated: one should be inspired,

original: spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: spro bar bya'o //
translated: and one should be delighted.

original: de'i @214b che ba yang theg pa chen po'i thabs kyi spyod pa brlabs po che rnams 'gag pa med pa la ni brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i @214b che ba yang theg pa chen po'i thabs kyi spyod pa brlabs po che rnams 'gag pa med pa la ni brjod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the greatness is expressed in the non-obstruction of the vast activities of the methods of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis dus gcig tu skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis dus gcig tu skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the two types of accumulations of merit and wisdom are generated simultaneously.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i phyir dang / sems can la phan pa brjod pa'i phyir dang / sems can la phan pa yin pa'i phyir bsod nams rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i phyir dang / sems can la phan pa brjod pa'i phyir dang / sems can la phan pa yin pa'i phyir bsod nams rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of expressing the qualities of the Tathagata, expressing the benefit for sentient beings, and being the benefit for sentient beings, merit is perfected.

original: chos gnyis su med pa'i don bden pa brjod pa yin zhing gnyis su med pa rgyud la bskyed pas ye shes rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gnyis su med pa'i don bden pa brjod pa yin zhing gnyis su med pa rgyud la bskyed pas ye shes rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the nonduality of phenomena is expressed in the truth, and by generating nonduality in the mindstream, gnosis is perfected.

original: de bas na pha rol du phyin pa'i tshul la mos pa'i gang zag ye shes kyi tshogs la lhur blangs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs zhar la bskyed par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang 'di lta bu yid la byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa brjod cing yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na pha rol du phyin pa'i tshul la mos pa'i gang zag ye shes kyi tshogs la lhur blangs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs zhar la bskyed par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang 'di lta bu yid la byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa brjod cing yid la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even those individuals who are devoted to the perfection mode and who are intent on the accumulation of gnosis but who wish to generate the accumulation of merit as a byproduct should bring to mind and recite the ultimate true name mantra of the Bhagavat Mañjuśrījñānasattva.

original: 'di nyid las skabs dang po nyid du /
analyzed: 'di nyid las skabs dang po nyid du /
translated: In this very [text], in the first section, it states:

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
translated: Endowed with the six kings of secret mantra,

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
translated: Arising as nondual, and this is taught to be the unborn nature.

original: zhes dam bca' mdzad nas /
analyzed: zhes dam bca' mdzad nas /
translated: Having made this promise,🔽It is taught:

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the bhagavat buddhas

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: Arise from the perfect buddha a.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog //
translated: A is the supreme of all letters.

original: don chen yi ge dam pa ste //
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa ste //
translated: It is the great meaning, the holy letter,

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: Arisen from within, unborn.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is free from verbal expression,🔽The supreme cause of all expression.

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces chos gnyis su med pa'i don 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod pas zhal gyis bzhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces chos gnyis su med pa'i don 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas mtshan brjod pas zhal gyis bzhes gsungs kyi /
translated: Thus, by proclaiming the name through teaching that the meaning of the nonduality of phenomena is the wisdom being Manjushri, he accepted.

original: don gzhan skabs phye ste ma gsungs so //
analyzed: don gzhan skabs phye ste ma gsungs so //
translated: He did not teach it to be some other meaning, but left it open for the occasion.

original: mjug tu yang rtsa ba'i sngags dang gzung bar dam bca' ba dang / phreng sngags kyi skabs su yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa mthong bar bya ba la aa bzhis byin gyis brlabs pa rtsa ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: mjug tu yang rtsa ba'i sngags dang gzung bar dam bca' ba dang / phreng sngags kyi skabs su yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa mthong bar bya ba la aa bzhis byin gyis brlabs pa rtsa ba'i sngags so //
translated: At the end, the root mantra is the pledge to uphold, and in the garland mantra, the root mantra is the consecration with the four A's for the purpose of seeing all phenomena as pure by nature.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par gzung bar bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par gzung bar bya ba la /
translated: The pledge to uphold is that all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku 'jam dpal yongs su dag par brjod pa khas len pa ni gzung bar dam @215a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku 'jam dpal yongs su dag par brjod pa khas len pa ni gzung bar dam @215a * //
translated: The promise to uphold the statement of the complete purity of Mañjuśrī, the body of all tathāgatas, is the pledge to uphold.

original: bcas pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku /
analyzed: bcas pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku /
translated: The Blessed One, the body of the wisdom being Mañjuśrī,

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra ba shin tu yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra ba shin tu yongs su dag pa /
translated: is like space, utterly pure,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po //
translated: the essence of the wisdom of the dharmadhātu,

original: aa gnyis kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: aa gnyis kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: blessed by the two A's,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs 'phrog pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs 'phrog pa /
translated: the heart of all buddhas,

original: sgrib pa thams cad bsreg pa ni phreng ba'i sngags yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad bsreg pa ni phreng ba'i sngags yin te /
translated: and burns away all obscurations. This is the mantra of the rosary.

original: de bas na 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gnyis su med pa'i mtshan brjod pa tsam ma gtogs pa gzhan mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gnyis su med pa'i mtshan brjod pa tsam ma gtogs pa gzhan mi gsung ngo //
translated: Therefore, here the Blessed One speaks of nothing other than the mere expression of the characteristic of the non-dual Dharma.

original: de la shes rab chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa chos gnyis su med pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la shes rab chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa chos gnyis su med pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: There, in order to manifest the non-dual Dharma, one should possess great wisdom and skillful means.

original: zhu ba zag pa med pa bzlog pas nyon mongs pa'i zag pa yang zad par 'gyur zhing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rgyud la bskyed par bya ba'i thabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhu ba zag pa med pa bzlog pas nyon mongs pa'i zag pa yang zad par 'gyur zhing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rgyud la bskyed par bya ba'i thabs gsungs pa /
translated: Since the uncontaminated state of melting is reversed, the afflictive contaminations are also exhausted, and the method of generating the nondual pristine consciousness in the mindstream is explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan brjod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan brjod pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān taught the recitation of the name.

original: 'di ltar 'di dbu zhabs su ni ye shes drug gi mtshan brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dbu zhabs su ni ye shes drug gi mtshan brjod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, from beginning to end, it is the recitation of the name of the six pristine consciousnesses.

original: ye shes drug gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: ye shes drug gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The six pristine consciousnesses are the characteristic of nondual pristine consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni me long lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni me long lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, nondual pristine consciousness is the characteristic of the mirror.

original: 'di ltar dri ma thams cad yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dri ma thams cad yongs su dag pas /
translated: Thus, since all taints are totally purified,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the reflection of all buddhas appears.

original: de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: That is the characteristic of uniformity.

original: bdag du lta ba'i gnas med de /
analyzed: bdag du lta ba'i gnas med de /
translated: There is no basis for the view of a self.

original: stobs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the source of the jewels of the qualities of the powers, the unique qualities, and so on.

original: de ni so sor rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni so sor rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: This is the characteristic of discerning.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral bas chos thams cad ji lta ba dang / ji snyed pa mkhyen pa dang ston pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral bas chos thams cad ji lta ba dang / ji snyed pa mkhyen pa dang ston pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from all grasping at signs, it is the basis for the knowledge of all phenomena as they are and all that exists, and for teaching them.

original: de ni bya ba grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni bya ba grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: This is the characteristic of successful activity.

original: sems can ma gzigs pas thugs rje dang mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ma gzigs pas thugs rje dang mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it does not see sentient beings, it is the basis for spontaneous compassion and activity.

original: de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is the characteristic of the purity of the dharmadhātu.

original: thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of all.

original: ye shes lngar phye ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes lngar phye ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The division into five gnoses is nondual gnosis.

original: de ni 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: That is Mañjuśrī, the gnosis being.

original: de ni don dam pa'i yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i yi ge aa'o //
translated: That is the ultimate letter A.

original: @215b byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: @215b byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: That is the thought of awakening.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' dang / kun du bzang po dang / bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i brjod pa yang de yin te de bzhin du mtshan nyid ji snyed par brjod pa yang tshig gi don de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' dang / kun du bzang po dang / bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i brjod pa yang de yin te de bzhin du mtshan nyid ji snyed par brjod pa yang tshig gi don de nyid yin no //
translated: Likewise, the expressions “Vajrasattva,” “Samantabhadra,” “Mahasukha,” and so on, are also that, and likewise, all the expressions of the characteristics are also that meaning of the word.

original: de dag nye bar ston pa 'di nyid las /🔽don chen yi ge dam pa ste //
analyzed: de dag nye bar ston pa 'di nyid las / don chen yi ge dam pa ste //
translated: In this very teaching of them,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “The great meaning is the holy letter.”

original: de 'dir dam pa'i yi ge'i sgra ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: de 'dir dam pa'i yi ge'i sgra ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Here, the sound of the holy letter is to be taken as uncontaminated wisdom.

original: zag pa de yang 'dir khams bcu'i bdag nyid can gzugs kyi phung po'i dbang dang bcas pa'i de'i bdag nyid kyi sa bon zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zag pa de yang 'dir khams bcu'i bdag nyid can gzugs kyi phung po'i dbang dang bcas pa'i de'i bdag nyid kyi sa bon zhes bshad do //
translated: And that contamination is explained here as the seed of the nature of the aggregate of form together with its controlling power, which has the nature of the ten elements.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa dag la go rims kyis gnas so zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa dag la go rims kyis gnas so zhes 'dod do //
translated: And that is asserted to abide in the order of the existences of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: 'dir rgal ba gzugs dbang po dang bcas pa'i zag pa bzlog pas /
analyzed: 'dir rgal ba gzugs dbang po dang bcas pa'i zag pa bzlog pas /
translated: Here, the objection is that the contamination of form together with the sense faculties is refuted.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i zag pa ji ltar ldog ce na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i zag pa ji ltar ldog ce na /
translated: How is it that the defilements of mind and mental factors are eliminated?

original: de ni 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba'i gang zag la gzugs kyi dri ma ni yongs su dag la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba'i gang zag la gzugs kyi dri ma ni yongs su dag la /
translated: It is impossible to say that the defilements of form are completely purified in the person who has mind and mental factors,

original: ming gzhi'i dri ma ni yongs su ma dag go zhes bya ba ni mi srid na /
analyzed: ming gzhi'i dri ma ni yongs su ma dag go zhes bya ba ni mi srid na /
translated: but that the defilements of the basis of name are not completely purified.

original: de bzhin du ming gzhi'i dri ma dag na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ming gzhi'i dri ma dag na /
translated: Similarly, it is impossible to say that the defilements of the basis of name are purified

original: gzugs kyi dri ma yang dag pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi dri ma yang dag pa yang mi srid de /
translated: but that the defilements of form are not purified.

original: 'on kyang gzugs ni cher rags shing gnas pa dang / dmigs par gyur pas de nyid dri ma sngon la gzhom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs ni cher rags shing gnas pa dang / dmigs par gyur pas de nyid dri ma sngon la gzhom par bya ba yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, since form is gross, stable, and manifest, it is the defilement that is first to be overcome.

original: de nyid bcom pas thams cad kyang dag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bcom pas thams cad kyang dag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When it is overcome, everything is purified.

original: dper na ljon shing gi rtse mo bcad gshags te /
analyzed: dper na ljon shing gi rtse mo bcad gshags te /
translated: For example, when the top of a tree is cut off,

original: mngon par skye ba'i gnas med par byas nas rtsa ba yang myur du med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon par skye ba'i gnas med par byas nas rtsa ba yang myur du med par 'gyur la /
translated: the place where it grows is destroyed, and the root quickly disappears.

original: phra mos kyang phan gnod byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mos kyang phan gnod byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is no longer harmed by the slightest thing.

original: de bzhin du zag pa 'bras bu nas bzlog na /
analyzed: de bzhin du zag pa 'bras bu nas bzlog na /
translated: In the same way, if the defilements are stopped from the effect,

original: rgyu yang myur du zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu yang myur du zad par 'gyur la /
translated: the cause will also be quickly exhausted,

original: phra mos kyang gnod par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mos kyang gnod par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and even the subtle ones will not be able to harm.

original: de bas na thabs mkhas pa rnams kyis yul du ni 'bras bu nas bzlog pa 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thabs mkhas pa rnams kyis yul du ni 'bras bu nas bzlog pa 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who are skillful should know this reversal from the effect in the object.

original: thabs dang shes rab zab mo'i tshul 'di thun mong du ma bstan pa'i dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zab mo'i tshul 'di thun mong du ma bstan pa'i dgongs pa ni /
translated: The intention of not teaching this method of profound means and wisdom in common is

original: thabs dang shes rab zhan pa rnams la nyes pa rgyu'i dus nas ma bzlog na /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zhan pa rnams la nyes pa rgyu'i dus nas ma bzlog na /
translated: that if the faults are not stopped from the time of the cause for those with weak means and wisdom,

original: 'bras bu mngon du smin pa'i dus na bzlog pa'i thabs med pa'i dbang du gsungs pa yin @216a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du smin pa'i dus na bzlog pa'i thabs med pa'i dbang du gsungs pa yin @216a * //
translated: there is no method to stop them when the effect has already ripened.

original: no ; / de bas na 'dir 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni ye shes drug gi bdag nyid dam pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa /
analyzed: no ; / de bas na 'dir 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni ye shes drug gi bdag nyid dam pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa /
translated: Therefore, here, Ārya Mañjuśrī is taught by the term “the supreme syllable, the nature of the six awarenesses.”

original: zag pa lnga yongs su zad pa'i ye shes bde ba chen po'i sku bde ba ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug gi rang bzhin skye ba'i skad cig ma bzhi /
analyzed: zag pa lnga yongs su zad pa'i ye shes bde ba chen po'i sku bde ba ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug gi rang bzhin skye ba'i skad cig ma bzhi /
translated: The body of great bliss, the intuition of the complete extinction of the five defilements, is the nature of the sixteen moments of the intuition of the joy of the first stage.

original: ye shes kyi mtha' can mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis dang bdag nyid tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mtha' can mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis dang bdag nyid tha dad pa med do //
translated: The two characteristics of the intuition of the end of the path and of the nondwelling nirvana are not different from the nature of the body of the Dharma.

original: de bas na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dang dbang gis phan pa ji snyed pa dang bde ba ji snyed pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa ;
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dang dbang gis phan pa ji snyed pa dang bde ba ji snyed pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa ;
translated: Therefore, the nondual Dharma is the basis of all benefits and all joys, mundane and transcendental,

original: rtsa bar gyur pa /🔽snying por gyur pa ni chos gnyis su med pa yin te /🔽de ltar yang gzhan las gsungs pa chos nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsa bar gyur pa / snying por gyur pa ni chos gnyis su med pa yin te / de ltar yang gzhan las gsungs pa chos nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is the root,🔽it is the essence.🔽And in other scriptures it is said that the twelve branches of the scriptures are the natural outflow of the Dharma Body.

original: 'di nyid las yon tan gyi skabs las kyang mtshan gzung ba chos gnyis su med pa 'dzin pa yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid las yon tan gyi skabs las kyang mtshan gzung ba chos gnyis su med pa 'dzin pa yin par gsungs te /
translated: And in the present scripture, in the chapter on the qualities of the Buddha, it is said that the retention of the name is the retention of the nondual Dharma.

original: de bas na de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand it in this way.

original: 'dir rgal ba /
analyzed: 'dir rgal ba /
translated: Here, the objection:

analyzed: zhen pa'am bsgrub pa'i rtsol ba yang mi bskyed de /

analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas de dag gos par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: One should not be defiled by grasping them.

original: 'di lta bu la gnas par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'di ltar snang ba thams cad ye shes rgyun gyi rol ba las sgo gsum gyi spyod pa ci yang ma bkag pa'i bsam pas mtshan brjod par bya'o //

translated: The yogi who wishes to abide in this way should recite the name with the thought that all appearances are the display of the stream of wisdom, without in any way obstructing the conduct of the three doors.

analyzed: de la dang por / aa a'a / ai a'i / au a'u / ae aee /

translated: o au, aṃ aḥ.

original: don 'di shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don 'di shes par bya ste /
translated: By reciting this, one should understand this meaning:

analyzed: yi ge sgyu 'phrul 'di ni /

analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub sems dpa'i tshul yin par shes par bya'o //

analyzed: yi ge 'khor lo'i tshul gyis 'jam dpal lo //
